H0.text: An oocyte is a mature egg that has finished meiosis twenty‑four hours before fertilization.

H1.text: Spermatozoa are the mature egg that has finished meiosis 24 hours before fertilization.

H2.text: Fetus is the mature form that the egg becomes twenty‑four hours before fertilization after it has finished meiosis.

H3.text: Zygote is the mature form of the egg twenty‑four hours before fertilization, after it has finished meiosis.

A4.text: The oocyte is arrested in Meiosis II at the stage of metaphase II at the diplotene stage and is considered a secondary oocyte.

A5.text: An oocyte is an immature ovum, an immature egg cell produced in a female fetus in the ovary during gametogenesis.

A6.text: If these oocytes are fertilized by sperm, they will resume and complete meiosis.

A7.text: Female mammals and birds are born possessing all the oocytes needed for future ovulations, and these oocytes are arrested at the prophase I stage of meiosis.

A8.text: The union of a human egg and sperm produces a zygote.

A9.text: The zygote is formed after fertilization, not before.
